bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to William Lochren, July 9, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Legation of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 9th 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. AUG 23 1895 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Legation of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 9th 1895.
Hon. William Lochren, Commissioner of Pensions, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor in replying to the letter sent J. C. Taylor of Arthington Montserrado County Liberia. I find record in this Consulate the following To the Honorable Commissioner of Pension Washington D.C.
Sir: I herewith transmit the documents relating to
the application for Pension by Messers Bryant Askie, Julius C. Taylor and William Newel. (J. C. Taylor is Julius C. Taylor referred above.)
Signed Beverly Y. Payne Vice Con. General Monrovia Liberia Feby 20, 1894
Mr. Taylor was examined filled out all the papers as did Mr Bryant Askie.
Please inform me if the papers were received?
I am obediently William H. Heard Min. Res. and Con. General
Enclosure 1 Letter to J. C. Taylor from Commissioner of Pension
